intro: Cnestis palala var. palala, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant features velvety, dark green leaves with a waxy texture and produces clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. It is often cultivated as a popular ornamental plant due to its beauty and ease of care. The species is well adapted to humid environments and thrives in partial shade.
